direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods modify the state of the iterator and require the same preconditions (nextCalled and not removed).
Both methods change the internal state of the iterator, although reset() does so more comprehensively.
Both methods involve state checks and modifications, and they both interact with the 'nextCalled' and 'removed' flags.

enhanced_by.reason: The constructor initializes the iterator state, which is a prerequisite for the set method.
The next method must be called before set can be invoked due to the requirement of 'nextCalled' being true.
The hasNext method can be used to verify the state of the iterator before and after the set method is called.
